documents.document: @monstercymru sell your story?
Literally the first moment that I've realised it's Thursday. Only knew it was 1st Feb yday thanks to @AVWoman's whi… https://t.co/0ayRwZjlND
I say four hours from home, that depends on some frankly unreliable omens of transport all going my way.
Evening all. Good day. Busy day. Head spinning. Four hours from home. Might have to stop making notes soon tho, starting to wilt.
Somewhat bedraggled journey. Now arriving in good time and with sunshine. Unexpected. Hope a good omen for visit and travel today.
And this is in part the story of @wienerlibrary too. These stories can't be told too often. https://t.co/OBeoiis0no
@byekitty @cartivist Mind, I think. (I am obvs missing the cake day, time to talk and all wellbeing events due to being too busy. Siiiigh.)
It is also #TimetoTalk day. I suspect I've banged on often enough about my occasional travails, but I am *always* happy to talk if it helps.
Morning world. On a train into a storm of unconfirmed dimensions (as in, one company has cancelled its services and mine bowls merrily on)
@LizzybArchivist @greensideknits oh, excellent. Thought I'd missed Sunetra. (I like her from way back in No Angels)
@greensideknits I think there are only one or two left, and it started before Christmas. Random.
Travel update: I should have gone to tomorrow's validation site tonight. Bother. Just cos I wanted one day not dragging my luggage around.
Why are BBC1 chuffing around with this series of wdytya so badly? I'm probably missing next one (in a fortnight) even if I remember it's on
@EmmaStagg ooh, exotic. I have an Ibis fairly soon. Scarlet.
@melindahaunton (Silent comment "would really be more of an achievement *not* to be descended from him")
*g* Enjoying the realism of Owain Gwynedd and his really an awful lot of children. She's beautifully calm about it.
@EmmaStagg I love a premier inn, but am undeniably having *quite* a lot of them this week. Purple.
Ooh, we going to Glamorgan too?
@greensideknits enabler. I shall do as you say, instantly.
Basically over the sniffles. Do I take cold meds tonight just so I sleep? Severely tempted. Travel tomorrow looks ghastly.
@GingerElanor yep, and Porthmadog etc. Worth a look.
Enjoying Greg Davies enjoying his great grandfather's misdeeds while still getting they were a tad serious.
Late checking in for WDYTYA but approving the actual Gwynedd Archives setting
Did get caught in a minor cloudburst, amidships. But otherwise all good. And certificate stayed dry which is what matters.
@Girlinthe that is not the way round I would have anticipated tbh. Assumed beige gloop w occasional florets. Huh.
Long day and a good day. One validation visit, one certificate presentation: #archivesaccreditn double header
@Girlinthe @CriticalSteph yes, always work canteen. One soup per day, outcome in lap of gods.
Arriving early for today's validation visit and waiting for rest of team. Surrounded by goldfinches. Surprising and good :-)
Morning world. No trains today. But otoh unknown bus system. Sure everything will be fine...
@missellabell had to wait 45 mins at an unfamiliar station and the cafe turned out to be independent with lovely tea and comfy chairs
This is excellent stuff. https://t.co/xBqrHYMfaI
@cmstaylor owowowow. I hope you're creating something fabulous and well worth the suffering :-)
This is terribly sad. Hadn't realised how fashionable/commonplace German food shops were c1911. My poor bloody grandad and his cuisine.
@DohertyTA yes, isn't it! If a bit disorienting how everything looks the same...
Back to hotel from dinner in time for Further Back in Time for Dinner. Splendid.
Location is secret but also this says it's at Freud. Which is almost enough for me alone. Best volunteer offer? https://t.co/I2WT6SxAKr
Ahhh. Premier inn nearer centre is bear place with cocktails. Excuse me drinking on a school night, it is mizzling and am far from home.
@PaolaOeste yes *but* jumper wearing much more de rigeur. I think. Glad you've got the woolly quotient high at start.
O generic premier inn slightly closer to the centre of a different town from last night! How familiar you feel!
One thing #archivesaccreditn travel teaches you: it is possible to have to much tea. Somewhere around seventh cup before 3pm I think.
@PaolaOeste not Denmark tho! Lovely grey mizzly days. And many cafes to hide in. Admittedly also unparalleled jumper-wearing opp.
@Schopflin taxi as long as likely to be non toxic. I got told off by a cabbie last night (mostly for existing) and am still cross.
@florencegirl January guilt complex, I resent you deeply. Especially as this trip goes firmly into February.
@PaolaOeste I have a slim list of necessities. Then consider how much space spare and what I can ram in extra. Minimalism ahaha. No.
@florencegirl (tho alas no hip flask and now I regret that)
@florencegirl (and yes, you are q safe from accusations of heightism, Sir Pterry all the way)
@florencegirl better than dwarf bread, I have *healthy* emergency flapjack. You will be amazed how long I can resist this.
I'm sorry everyone on this carriage. Experimenting with a couple of hours between cold meds. Apparently still quite drippy.
Not heading towards London. On the roooooooaad. Hey ho.
First of three consecutive validation visits btw. Sniffles unabated. Doing my best to breathe, remain positive and interested. Not too hard.
Improbably lovely station cafe whose location I can't currently share. Remind me after next Accreditation panel. It gives rail travel hope.
Morning world. Feeling oddly isolated and not only due to out of town hotel. Stay safe.
@byekitty cheese is an excellent start tho
It's true - Georgian papers at the Royal Archives are a fascinating thing. Even if I'm watching something else for… https://t.co/Mjjvy2FsV2
@melindahaunton hoping this is just the intro and we get something more obscure soon (also hope that's a facsimile he's handling)
I have so far seen everything Andrew G-D is looking at in the Art of France: St Denis, Ste Chapelle, Tres Riches Heures. No more worlds?
That petition's about to past 1.5 million, btw. Almost 4.5% of my sluggish constituency have signed. Next thing you know we'll have signage.
Going to watch the Art of France at 9, I think. Geo III looks excellent too, though. Why must all the good TV clash?
@Girlinthe uni challenge just ending. I have been irritably shouting about the Electors of the Holy Roman Emp.
@Girlinthe as you say. Many more chances will arise. Bloody hell.
@Girlinthe (tho am following so many people tweeting protests, it could escape me. Where am I? On a ring road Elsewhere. Pffft.)
@Girlinthe it does sound a bit like When Multitasking Goes Bad. But haven't spotted anything scrolling by perturbingly yet
Things I can't get used to in hotels: mirrors placed so I catch glimpses of myself watching TV.
Cor. Hotel Chocolat mojito ones do not mess about (this is death of diet as prev advised). Breathing fire.
You know it's not a great travel day when I have hotel tea with my dinner. Everything is cold.
Mwahaha I already have mine (for a bank holiday Monday eve which isn't exactly lush. But *still*) https://t.co/rwg99yFaho
@stefarchivist that is v cheering for the Younger Generation etc. Thank you. #cheese
All my kit is crap and I have four weeks on the road *and* the sniffles *AND* galloping self-pity. (Punctuate with inelegant snort pls)
Mostly in fact grumpy cos my laptop switched itself on and wasted its battery. It does this sometimes and takes forever to charge. Harrumph
Good hotel news: wifi fast enough to do my yoga vid. Bad: storage heaters, ring road. Grump.
O generic premier inn on a ring road, how familiar you are although we have never met before.
@Girlinthe nothing could be quite like that!
@Girlinthe I will definitely come to exhibition and maybe an event if I can. But I like your launches :-)
I *wish* I could have been at this. https://t.co/bwJtlhbPJ1
It is very light brown outside this train. Not enticing. Have wholly blown diet already, too. Work travel.
Oh. *looks at only card expiry* https://t.co/S09hvaqoMx
Okay folks. Travel now. Can't really say where, but assume lengthy and #archivesaccreditn related... (till end of Thursday)
@greensideknits seems like plenty of availability. Good luck!
Huh, Painlessly getting a Hamilton ticket. For 14 months' time but still painless, even tho in lunch hour.
@byekitty wrapped in pastry, though. So probably not.
@melindahaunton updated: also one cherry tomato, lots of rice and some grain mustard. It's not vile, just disconnected.

@annamcnally We need food! This is food! Therefore it is a meal!
Um.
Soup is allegedly carrot but currently unobtainable therefore lunch is peculiar vegetable wellington (rice, sultanas, carrots??) #souptweets
@MaireadO oh fab! Start them young, get them on the right track.
Ahahaha, in the office this morning ahead of a 3.5 day trip, almost forgot to take notebook and writing things with me. *mental notes*
Morning world. Start of a week of travel and I have a persistent sniffle. Sorry for the incredibly annoying soundtrack
@MaireadO I am stuck with the last disc of season 7 on my rewatch. Different inauguration = too much just now.
@sadie_seduskie long haul, self-care. Also gym \o/ Good for you.
@MariaSienk the fingers are *very* well done, though...
@hils_k am writing, and every five mins I let myself check in on the count. Cheering, in a bleak world.
@gill_othen not sure I'm allowed to sign these, but I have. Went up 5k between completing form and validating email address.
Morning world. I once supported UK citizenship application for an Iranian physicist, and today that feels like an excellent thing for my cv.
@melindahaunton Tom Hollander is, not incidentally, getting some lovely repellent roles at the moment.
Oh god. Laughed so loudly at #Taboo just then. Sometimes I am easily pleased.
@MariaSienk those are very good things. (I've been journaling 3 good things most days this month to try to keep sane amid chaos. Go you!)
Everyone who wants Almeida Mary Stuart in reverse, take note! https://t.co/dChDyoZ7XF
@Girlinthe true. Tho @vicky_ig's zine workshops have let me get out a lot of records-related anger *and* decorative borders before now.
@northnorth_west really? I *wish* I'd seen Stevenson as Mary! Wd love to know what Williams made of Elizabeth too...
@Historyscape oh me too! I need to read Cliff notes or similar. Too resonant a name to throw away.
@Frieda_M @byekitty knew we were keeping @HenryColesRat for a good reason.
